div.p: Modify scale options to give a web site additional load capacity and/or fault tolerance.
Scale management page options affect load capacity or fault tolerance for a web site as follows:

ul.li:
Web Site Mode – Shared mode by default. A web site running in Shared mode is co-located with other web sites running in shared mode. You can decide which sites you want to run in Free Intro Shared mode and which sites you want to run in Basic Shared mode. Intro Shared mode has strict quotas and Basic Shared mode has more relaxed quotas. The maximum number of sites you can run in Intro Shared mode may vary with your plan.
When Web Site Mode is changed from Shared to Reserved you can scale up the web site by increasing the value of the web site’s Reserved Instance Size. The Reserved mode applies to all your sites and makes them run on dedicated compute instances. The default value for Reserved Instance Size is Small but can be increased to Medium or Large to provide scale up.
Shared Instance Count - provides fault tolerance and improved performance through scale out by allocating the specified number of shared compute instances to the web site.
Reserved Instance Count - provides fault tolerance and improved performance through scale out by dedicating the specified number of compute instances to the web site.
